title: Can Master Yi's wuju style be converted to Physical damage so you can actually build against it?
body: Given just how accessible both physical damage and attack speed is these days - can Yi's Wuju style be converted to physical damage so that he actually has to pick Conqueror or build crit to deal true damage? You've stated yourself that a champion's only counterplay should never be "cc them".

replies.body: I dont see why youd need to. Hes a melee hyper carry whos only stat is damage. Plus iirc its flat damage, meaning you can already build against it with both HP and AS reduction.
He builds {{item:1416}} /{{item:1419}} (if he is jungle) and {{item:3153}} making hp pretty useless.  Atk speed reduction doesnt work since he is immune to slows during his ulti.

Youre still building armor, as the majority of his damage is physical, and botrk isnt true damage. Youre still looking at, what is that? 3 full items + boots to have jungle, botrk and rageblade? None of which provide any defensive stats. Thats not gunna work well in a real game. At that point "just CC him" is a real comment because he has nothing to handle that and no survivability to live through even a small breeze.

You think this trully works? In theory yes its simple. Now practice is where it becomes complicated. For many different reasons. Many of those are why "just cc him" is as stupid as it can get.  Good luck cc him when he is running at the god damn speed of sound, and more likely than not, your hard cc is a skillshot.

And Nasus is still fully capable of winning the 1v1 against Yi, provided he isn't behind since Yi is often so damn squishy.

Thing is, he is usually 2-3 levels above everybody else and has very high scaling base stats, coupled with slow/disable immunity, untargetability, 2.0 attack speed without attack speed items and so high movement speed nobody can outrun him.

You wont have the damage to burst him down. By the time you get this damage, he typically has more of his build filled in - with items that provide health and resistances, negating your burst damage. 

"He should be dead before he even gets near you" He ults, flashes close enough to Q on top of his target and kills them in three basic attacks - roughly 0.4 seconds. He also has four teammates you have to worry about as well, which may also require whatever cc your champion has at hand.

Point is, at the moment counterplay to Yi depends solely on Yi making mistakes. You can't outplay him because he outstats everybody else than Fizz and Camille - even Jax struggles against him.

You can't cc him, because he can turn untargetable, he can flash and he can have allies help him out (Morgana, or any support capable of building shielding + mikaels crucible.)

You can't dps him because he oneshots anyone that builds damage.
You can't oneshot him because he oneshots anyone that builds damage. Veigar is a reasonable exception - although just like all of the assassins, Yi's W negates their burst damage along with whatever tank items he builds after his 2 or 3 damage items.

You can ban him, but it shouldn't be necessary - you shouldnt be required to ban a champion to be able to play the game. Leaving Yi open means he gets picked on one of the teams - thus you have to play one of the few champions capable of locking him down or bursting him down to have a chance.
